body:
# Mochi
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/gitlato/mochi.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/sundaecr/mochi)

![Image of Mochi](https://image.shutterstock.com/image-vector/mochi-character-design-wallpaper-free-260nw-1572610879.jpg)

Mochi is a shard inspired by devise for ruby. Mochi handles everything authentication. Currently amber is the only supported framework with both granite and jennifer orms being supported. I am open to other frameworks being supported, such as lucky, but there is a lot to do before that. If you want this to work with lucky asap, you'll have to open a pull request right now.

The Mochi CLI makes installation easy. Please give a thanks to the amber core team for their CLI. I have pulled it out of amber to use as a base. 

## Documentation
### API Docs
[API Documentation](https://gitlato.github.io/mochi/)

### Gitbook
[Gitbook](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/)

## Mochi Modules
> **Note:** Only the class 'User' is supported. This probably will not change due to crystal being staticly typed. I am open to changing this if i find a solid implementation.

Currently, Mochi has 7 modules:  

1. **[Authenticable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/authenticable)**
  - Basic authentication. Sign up, sign in, sign out.  
  - Mandatory columns:  
    - `email`: String - User's sign up email
    - `password_digest`: String? - User's password stored as a bcrypt digest

  > **Note:** Mochi also puts 'password' and 'new_password' in as attributes, however we don't want these saved in plain text so do NOT add them as columns.

2. **[Confirmable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/confirmable)**  
  - Users are required to confirm their email prior to activation. Mochi generates a UUID for each user and sends an email. This UUID is for user activation and verification
  - Mandatory columns:  
    - `confirmation_token`: String - Token used for email activation & verification
    - `confirmed`: Bool - True if user account is activated
    - `confirmed_at`: Timestamp? - Time user confirmed account
    - `confirmation_sent_at`: Timestamp? - Time confirmation email sent
    - `unconfirmed_email`: String? - An email address copied from the email attr after confirmation.
  
3. **[Omniauthable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/omniauthable)**  
  - Users can sign up with google, facebook, github, twitter or vk. (Google is still WIP)
  - Mandatory columns:
    - `uid`: String? - Identifaction number used for sign-in verification (These user's do not have a `password_digest` or `email`)

4. **[Trackable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/trackable)**
  - Tracks user's sign in count, ip addresses and sign in time
  - Mandatory columns:
    - `sign_in_count`: Integer - Total amount of times a user has successfully signed in
    - `current_sign_in_ip`: String? - The most recent IP address used to sign in
    - `last_sign_in_ip`: String? - The second most recent IP address used to sign in
    - `current_sign_in_at`: Timestamp? - The time a user last signed in at
    - `last_sign_in_at`: Timestamp? - The second most recent time a user signed in

5. **[Recoverable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/recoverable)**
  - Allows users to reset password via email link
  - Mandatory columns:
    - `reset_password_sent_at`: Timestamp? - Time password reset email was sent at
    - `reset_password_token`: String? - UUID token for verification
    - `password_reset_in_progress`: Bool - returns true when a password reset was initialized but not confirmed & completed.

6. **[Lockable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/lockable)**
  - User's have X number of times to log in before account is locked & email verification occurs
  - Mandatory columns:
    - `locked_at`: Timestamp? - Time account was locked at
    - `unlock_token`: String? - UUID token for verification
    - `failed_attempts`: Integer - Number of attempts currently failed since last sign in

7. **[Invitable](https://awcrotwell.gitbook.io/mochi/guides/invitable)**
  - User's can invite other users. Inviter inputs email, email sent out, invitee inputs password, account is confirmed if confirmable is active.
  - Mandatory columns:
    - `invitation_accepted_at`: Timestamp? - Time invitee accepted invite
    - `invitation_created_at`: Timestamp? - Time inviter created invite
    - `invitation_token`: String? - UUID verification token
    - `invited_by`: Integer? - Inviter user id
    - `invitation_sent_at`: Timestamp? - Time invite email was sent (same as `invitiation_created_at`)

types.name: ApplicationController
types.doc:
Main Controller for Amber. All other controller inherit from here.
This opens up the class to insert this method

Due to the way Amber initializers work, we need this here to ensure the compiler can find this class before it finds classes trying to inherit from it

instance_methods.doc: Returns the current_user.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the current_user.

types.name: Configuration
types.doc:
Main configuration class for mochi
Holds all variables for configuration (excluding omniauthable)

Usage:

```
Mochi.setup do |config|
  config.property = X
end
```
types.summary: Main configuration class for mochi Holds all variables for configuration (excluding omniauthable)

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc: Used to create a new password recovery
instance_methods.summary: Used to create a new password recovery

def.name: create
def.body:
user = User.new
user.email = params[:email]
if cur_usr = current_user
  invited_by = cur_usr.id
end
if invited_by && (user.invite!(invited_by))
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "Invite successfully created & sent."})
else
  flash[:danger] = "Could not create new invite. Please try again."
  render("invitable/new.ecr")
end

def.name: edit
def.body:
if user
else
  return redirect_to("/", flash: {"danger" => "Invalid authenticity token."})
end
render("invitable/edit.ecr")

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc: Used to confirm & reactive a user account
instance_methods.summary: Used to confirm & reactive a user account

def.name: update
def.body:
if user
else
  return redirect_to("/", flash: {"danger" => "Invalid."})
end
user.password = params[:password]
if user.accept_invitation!
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "Invite accepted."})
else
  flash[:danger] = "Could accept invite. Please try again."
  render("invitable/edit.ecr")
end

def.name: callback
def.body:
url = "#{Amber.settings.host}/omniauth/#{params[:provider]}/callback"
fakeuser = Mochi::Omniauthable::Provider.user(params[:provider], {"code" => params[:code]}, url)
user = User.find_by(uid: fakeuser.uid)
if user
  session[:user_id] = user.uid
  flash[:info] = "Successfully logged in"
  redirect_to("/")
else
  flash[:danger] = "Invalid. It doesn't look like you have registered"
  redirect_to("/")
end

def.name: callback
def.body:
url = "#{Amber.settings.host}/omniauth/#{params[:provider]}/callback"
fakeuser = Mochi::Omniauthable::Provider.user(params[:provider], {"code" => params[:code]}, url)
user = User.where do
  _uid == fakeuser.uid
end.first
if user
  session[:user_id] = user.uid
  flash[:info] = "Successfully logged in"
  redirect_to("/")
else
  flash[:danger] = "Invalid. It doesn't look like you have registered"
  redirect_to("/")
end

def.name: callback
def.body:
callback_url = "#{Amber.settings.host}/omniauth/user/#{params[:provider]}/callback"
fakeuser = Mochi::Omniauthable::Provider.user(params[:provider], {"code" => params[:code]}, callback_url)
user = User.new(fakeuser)
if user.save
  session[:user_id] = user.uid
  flash[:info] = "Successfully logged in"
  redirect_to("/")
else
  flash[:danger] = "Invalid email or password"
  redirect_to("/")
end

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc: Used to create a new password recovery
instance_methods.summary: Used to create a new password recovery

def.name: create
def.body:
if user
  if (user.reset_password(recovery_params[:new_password])) && user.send_reset_password_instructions
    redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "Password reset. Please check your email"})
  else
    flash[:danger] = "Some error occurred. Please try again."
    user = User.new
    render("recovery/new.ecr")
  end
else
  flash[:danger] = "Could not find user with that email."
  user = User.new
  render("recovery/new.ecr")
end

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc: Used to confirm & reactive a user account
instance_methods.summary: Used to confirm & reactive a user account

def.name: update
def.body:
if user
else
  user = User.new
  return redirect_to("/reset/password", flash: {"danger" => "Invalid authenticity token."})
end
if (user.reset_password_by_token!(recovery_params["reset_token"])) && user.errors.empty?
  if Mochi.configuration.sign_in_after_reset_password
    if user.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Trackable)
      user.update_tracked_fields!(request)
    end
    session[:user_id] = user.id
    redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "Successfully reset password."})
  else
    redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "Password has been reset. Please sign in."})
  end
else
  flash[:danger] = "Invalid authenticity token."
  render("recovery/new.ecr")
end

def.name: update
def.body:
if user.nil?
  return redirect_to("/", flash: {"danger" => "Invalid authenticity token."})
end
if user.confirm! && user.save
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "User has been confirmed."})
else
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"danger" => "Token has expired."})
end

def.name: create
def.body:
if user
else
  flash[:danger] = "Invalid email or password"
  user = User.new
  return render("session/new.ecr")
end
if user.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Recoverable) && user.password_reset_in_progress
  flash[:warning] = "Please finish resetting your password"
  return render("session/new.ecr")
end
if (user.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Confirmable) && (!user.confirmation_period_valid?)) && (!user.confirmed?)
  flash[:warning] = "Please activate your account"
  return render("session/new.ecr")
end
if user.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Lockable) && (!user.valid_for_authentication?)
  flash[:warning] = "Your account is locked. Please unlock it before signing in"
  return render("session/new.ecr")
end
if user.valid_password?(user_params[:password])
  session[:user_id] = user.id
  flash[:success] = "Successfully logged in"
  if user.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Trackable)
    user.update_tracked_fields!(request)
  end
  redirect_to("/")
else
  if user.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Lockable)
    failed_sign_in(user)
  end
  flash[:danger] = "Invalid email or password"
  render("session/new.ecr")
end

def.name: destroy
def.body:
session.delete(:user_id)
flash[:info] = "Logged out. See ya later!"
redirect_to("/")

def.name: update
def.body:
if user.nil?
  return redirect_to("/", flash: {"danger" => "Invalid authenticity token."})
end
if user.unlock_access!
  if Mochi.configuration.sign_in_after_unlocking
    session[:user_id] = user.id
  end
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "Account has been unlocked"})
else
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"danger" => "Token has expired."})
end

def.name: before_filters
def.body:
filters.register(:before) do
begin
    only([:show, :edit, :update, :destroy]) do
      set_user
    end
  endend

def.name: create
def.body:
user = User.new(user_params.validate!)
user.password = params[:password]
if user.valid? && user.save
  session[:user_id] = user.id
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => success_message(user)})
else
  flash[:danger] = "Could not create Resource!"
  render("user/new.ecr")
end

def.name: destroy
def.body:
user = current_user.not_nil!
user.destroy
redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "User has been deleted."})

def.name: update
def.body:
user = current_user.not_nil!
user.set_attributes(user_params.validate!)
if user.save
  redirect_to("/", flash: {"success" => "User has been updated."})
else
  flash[:danger] = "Could not update User!"
  render("user/edit.ecr")
end

types.name: Authenticable
types.doc:
Authenticatable Module, responsible for hashing the password and
validating the authenticity of a user while signing in.
types.summary: Authenticatable Module, responsible for hashing the password and validating the authenticity of a user while signing in.

instance_methods.name: password=
instance_methods.doc:
Generates a hashed password based on the given value.
We use `password_digest` to store the hashed password.
instance_methods.summary: Generates a hashed password based on the given value.

instance_methods.name: password_changed?
instance_methods.doc: Checks if the records password has changed
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the records password has changed

instance_methods.name: valid_email?
instance_methods.doc: Verify email matches regex
instance_methods.summary: Verify email matches regex

def.name: valid_email?
def.body:
if (em = self.email)
  match = em.match(/\A[\w+\-.]+@[a-z\d\-]+(\.[a-z]+)*\.[a-z]+\z/i)
  match ? (  match.string == em) : invalid_email()
else
  invalid_email()
end

instance_methods.name: valid_password?
instance_methods.doc: Verifies whether a password (ie from sign in) is the user password.
instance_methods.summary: Verifies whether a password (ie from sign in) is the user password.

instance_methods.name: valid_password_size?
instance_methods.doc: Ensures the given password is atleast 6 characters
instance_methods.summary: Ensures the given password is atleast 6 characters

types.name: Confirmable
types.doc:
Confirmable is responsible to verify if an account is already confirmed to
sign in, and to send emails with confirmation instructions.
Confirmation instructions are sent to the user email after creating a
record and when manually requested by a new confirmation instruction request.

Confirmable tracks the following columns:

* confirmation_token   - A unique random token
* confirmed_at         - A timestamp when the user clicked the confirmation link
* confirmation_sent_at - A timestamp when the confirmation_token was generated (not sent)
* unconfirmed_email    - An email address copied from the email attr after confirmation. This value is copied to the email attr then cleared

== Options

Confirmable adds the following options to mochi:

  * `allow_unconfirmed_access_for`: the time you want to allow the user to access their account before confirming it. After this period, the user access is denied. You can use this to let your user access some features of your application without confirming the account, but blocking it after a certain period (ie 7 days). By default `allow_unconfirmed_access_for` is zero, it means users always have to confirm to sign in.
  * `reconfirmable`: requires any email changes to be confirmed (exactly the same way as initial account confirmation) to be applied. Requires additional unconfirmed_email db field to be set up (t.reconfirmable in migrations). Until confirmed, new email is stored in unconfirmed email column, and copied to email column on successful confirmation. Also, when used in conjunction with `send_email_changed_notification`, the notification is sent to the original email when the change is requested,  not when the unconfirmed email is confirmed.
  * `confirm_within`: the time before a sent confirmation token becomes invalid. You can use this to force the user to confirm within a set period of time. Confirmable will not generate a new token if a repeat confirmation is requested during this time frame, unless the user's email changed too.

Examples

 `User.find(1).confirm       # returns true unless it's already confirmed`

 `User.find(1).confirmed?    # true/false`

 `User.find(1).send_confirmation_instructions # manually send instructions`
types.summary: Confirmable is responsible to verify if an account is already confirmed to sign in, and to send emails with confirmation instructions.

instance_methods.name: confirm!
instance_methods.doc:
Confirm a user by setting it's confirmed_at to actual time. If the user
is already confirmed, add an error to email field. If the user is invalid
add errors
instance_methods.summary: Confirm a user by setting it's confirmed_at to actual time.

def.name: confirm!
def.body:
if confirmation_period_expired?
  return false
end
confirm()
save

instance_methods.name: confirmation_period_valid?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the confirmation for the user is within the limit time.
We do this by calculating if the difference between today and the
confirmation sent date does not exceed the confirm in time configured.
allow_unconfirmed_access_for is a model configuration, must always be an integer value.

Example:

  - `allow_unconfirmed_access_for = 1.day and confirmation_sent_at = today`

    `confirmation_period_valid?   # returns true`

  - `allow_unconfirmed_access_for = 5.days and confirmation_sent_at = 4.days.ago`

    `confirmation_period_valid?   # returns true`

  - `allow_unconfirmed_access_for = 5.days and confirmation_sent_at = 5.days.ago`

    `confirmation_period_valid?   # returns false`

  - `allow_unconfirmed_access_for = 0.days`

    `confirmation_period_valid?   # will always return false`

  - `allow_unconfirmed_access_for = nil`

    `confirmation_period_valid?   # will always return true`
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the confirmation for the user is within the limit time.

def.name: confirmation_period_valid?
def.body:
if Mochi.configuration.allow_unconfirmed_access_for.nil?
  return true
end
if Mochi.configuration.allow_unconfirmed_access_for == 0.days
  return false
end
allow_unconfirmed_access_for = Mochi.configuration.allow_unconfirmed_access_for
if allow_unconfirmed_access_for
else
  return false
end
sent_at = confirmation_sent_at
if sent_at
else
  return false
end
sent_at >= (Time.utc - allow_unconfirmed_access_for.days)

instance_methods.name: generate_confirmation_token
instance_methods.doc:
Generates a new random token for confirmation, and stores
the time this token is being generated in confirmation_sent_at
instance_methods.summary: Generates a new random token for confirmation, and stores the time this token is being generated in confirmation_sent_at

instance_methods.name: send_confirmation_instructions
instance_methods.doc:
Send confirmation email.

Mutating Method.
Examples:

  - `user.send_confirmation_instructions # returns true/false`
instance_methods.summary: Send confirmation email.

def.name: send_confirmation_instructions
def.body:
(mailer_class = Mochi.configuration.mailer_class) ? (if mailer_class
else
  return
end) : return
(token = confirmation_token) ? (if token
else
  return
end) : return
mailer_class.new.confirmation_instructions(self, token)
self.confirmation_sent_at = Time.utc
save

types.name: Invitable
types.doc:
Invitable is responsible for sending invitation emails.
When an invitation is sent to an email address, an account is created for it.
Invitation email contains a link allowing the user to accept the invitation
by setting a password (as reset password from Devise's recoverable module).

Configuration:

  accept_invitation_within: The period the generated invitation token is valid. After this period, the invited resource won't be able to accept the invitation. When accept_invitation_within is 0 (the default), the invitation won't expire.

Examples:

  `User.find(1).invited_to_sign_up?      # => true/false`

  `User.invite!                          # => send invitation`

  `User.accept_invitation!               # => accept invitation with a token`

  `User.find(1).accept_invitation!       # => accept invitation`

  `User.find(1).invite!                  # => reset invitation status and send invitation again`
types.summary: Invitable is responsible for sending invitation emails.

instance_methods.name: accept_invitation
instance_methods.doc: Accept an invitation by clearing invitation token and and setting invitation_accepted_at
instance_methods.summary: Accept an invitation by clearing invitation token and and setting invitation_accepted_at

def.name: accept_invitation

instance_methods.name: accept_invitation!
instance_methods.doc:
Accept an invitation by clearing invitation token and and setting invitation_accepted_at
Saves the model and confirms it if model is confirmable, running invitation_accepted callbacks
instance_methods.summary: Accept an invitation by clearing invitation token and and setting invitation_accepted_at Saves the model and confirms it if model is confirmable, running invitation_accepted callbacks

def.name: accept_invitation!
def.body:
if valid_invitation?
  self.accept_invitation
  self.save
  if persisted?
  else
    self.rollback_accepted_invitation
  end
  @accepting_invitation = false
  true
else
  false
end

instance_methods.name: accepted_or_not_invited?
instance_methods.doc: Verifies whether a user has accepted an invitation (false when user is accepting it), or was never invited
instance_methods.summary: Verifies whether a user has accepted an invitation (false when user is accepting it), or was never invited

instance_methods.name: accepting_invitation
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if `accept_invitation` was invoked
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if #accept_invitation was invoked

instance_methods.name: accepting_invitation=
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if `accept_invitation` was invoked
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if #accept_invitation was invoked

instance_methods.name: created_by_invite?
instance_methods.doc: Verify wheather a user is created by invitation, irrespective to invitation status
instance_methods.summary: Verify wheather a user is created by invitation, irrespective to invitation status

instance_methods.name: invitation_accepted?
instance_methods.doc: Verifies whether a user accepted an invitation (false when user is accepting it)
instance_methods.summary: Verifies whether a user accepted an invitation (false when user is accepting it)

def.name: invitation_due_at
def.body:
if (Mochi.configuration.accept_invitation_within == 0) || Mochi.configuration.accept_invitation_within.nil?
  return nil
end
time = self.invitation_created_at || self.invitation_sent_at
time + Mochi.configuration.accept_invitation_within

instance_methods.name: invite!
instance_methods.doc:
Main method for inviting
Reset invitation token and send invitation again
instance_methods.summary: Main method for inviting Reset invitation token and send invitation again

def.name: invite!
def.body:
self.invitation_created_at = Time.utc
if skip_invitation
else
  self.invitation_sent_at = self.invitation_created_at
end
self.invited_by = invited_by
self.invitation_token = generate_invitation_token
if save
  (  token = invitation_token) ? (  if token
  else
    return
  end) : return
  (  mailer_class = Mochi.configuration.mailer_class) ? (  if mailer_class
  else
    return
  end) : return
  if skip_invitation
  else
    mailer_class.new.invitation_instructions(self, token)
  end
  true
else
  rollback_invitation
end

instance_methods.name: invited_to_sign_up?
instance_methods.doc: Verifies whether a user has been invited or not
instance_methods.summary: Verifies whether a user has been invited or not

def.name: rollback_accepted_invitation
def.body:
self.invitation_token = @invitation_token_was
self.invitation_accepted_at = nil
if @confirmation_set && self.is_a?(Mochi::Models::Confirmable)
  self.confirmed_at = nil
end

def.name: rollback_invitation
def.body:
self.invitation_token = nil
self.invitation_created_at = nil
self.invited_by = nil
self.invitation_sent_at = nil

instance_methods.name: valid_invitation?
instance_methods.doc:
Verify whether a invitation is active or not. If the user has been
invited, we need to calculate if the invitation time has not expired
for this user, in other words, if the invitation is still valid.
instance_methods.summary: Verify whether a invitation is active or not.

types.name: Lockable
types.doc:
Handles blocking a user access after a certain number of attempts.
Lockable accepts two different strategies to unlock a user after it's
blocked: email and time. The former will send an email to the user when
the lock happens, containing a link to unlock its account. The second
will unlock the user automatically after some configured time (ie 2.hours).
It's also possible to set up lockable to use both email and time strategies.

Options

Lockable adds the following options to +devise+:

  - `maximum_attempts`: how many attempts should be accepted before blocking the user.
  - `unlock_in`: the time you want to lock the user after to lock happens. Only available when unlock_strategy is :time or :both.
  - `last_attempt_warning`: The message users recieve when they are on their final login attempt - WIP
types.summary: Handles blocking a user access after a certain number of attempts.

instance_methods.name: access_locked?
instance_methods.doc: Verifies whether a user is locked or not.
instance_methods.summary: Verifies whether a user is locked or not.

instance_methods.name: lock_access!
instance_methods.doc:
Lock a user setting its locked_at to actual time.
  when you lock access, you could pass the
  `skip_email: true` as an option.
instance_methods.summary: Lock a user setting its locked_at to actual time.

def.name: lock_access!
def.body:
self.locked_at = Time.utc
self.unlock_token = UUID.random.to_s
if !skip_email
  send_unlock_instructions
end
save

instance_methods.name: resend_unlock_instructions
instance_methods.doc: Resend the unlock instructions if the user is locked.
instance_methods.summary: Resend the unlock instructions if the user is locked.

instance_methods.name: send_unlock_instructions
instance_methods.doc: Send unlock instructions by email
instance_methods.summary: Send unlock instructions by email

def.name: send_unlock_instructions
def.body:
(mailer_class = Mochi.configuration.mailer_class) ? (if mailer_class
else
  return
end) : return
(token = self.unlock_token) ? (if token
else
  return
end) : return
mailer_class.new.unlock_instructions(self, token)

instance_methods.name: unlock_access!
instance_methods.doc: Unlock a user by cleaning locked_at and failed_attempts.
instance_methods.summary: Unlock a user by cleaning locked_at and failed_attempts.

def.name: unlock_access!
def.body:
self.locked_at = nil
self.failed_attempts = 0
self.unlock_token = nil
save

instance_methods.name: valid_for_authentication?
instance_methods.doc:
Overwrites valid_for_authentication? from Devise::Models::Authenticatable
for verifying whether a user is allowed to sign in or not. If the user
is locked, it should never be allowed.
instance_methods.summary: Overwrites valid_for_authentication? from Devise::Models::Authenticatable for verifying whether a user is allowed to sign in or not.

def.name: valid_for_authentication?
def.body:
if lock_expired?
  unlock_access!
end
if access_locked?
else
  return true
end
false

types.name: Recoverable
types.doc:
Recoverable takes care of resetting the user password and send reset instructions.

Options

Recoverable adds the following options:

  * +reset_password_within+: the time period within which the password must be reset or the token expires.
  * +sign_in_after_reset_password+: whether or not to sign in the user automatically after a password reset.

== Examples

  # resets the user password and save the record, true if valid passwords are given, otherwise false
  User.find(1).reset_password('password123')

  # creates a new token and send it with instructions about how to reset the password
  User.find(1).send_reset_password_instructions
types.summary: Recoverable takes care of resetting the user password and send reset instructions.

instance_methods.name: clear_reset_password_token
instance_methods.doc: Removes reset_password token
instance_methods.summary: Removes reset_password token

def.name: clear_reset_password_token
def.body:
self.reset_password_token = nil
self.reset_password_sent_at = nil
self.password_reset_in_progress = false

instance_methods.name: reset_password
instance_methods.doc:
Update password saving the record and clearing token. Returns true if
the passwords are valid and the record was saved, false otherwise.
instance_methods.summary: Update password saving the record and clearing token.

def.name: reset_password
def.body:
if !new_password.empty?
  self.password = new_password
  save
else
  raise("Password is blank")
end

instance_methods.name: reset_password_by_token!
instance_methods.doc:
If a users token is still valid, clear reset fields and automatically
try saving the record. If not user is found, returns a new user
containing an error in reset_password_token attribute.
Attributes must contain reset_password_token, password and confirmation
instance_methods.summary: If a users token is still valid, clear reset fields and automatically try saving the record.

def.name: reset_password_by_token!
def.body:
if self.reset_password_token != token
  return false
end
if self.password_reset_in_progress
else
  return false
end
if !reset_password_period_valid?
  return false
end
clear_reset_password_token()
save

instance_methods.name: reset_password_period_valid?
instance_methods.doc:
Checks if the reset password token sent is within the limit time.
We do this by calculating if the difference between today and the
sending date does not exceed the confirm in time configured.
Returns true if the resource is not responding to reset_password_sent_at at all.
reset_password_within is a model configuration, must always be an integer value.

Example:

  # reset_password_within = 1.day and reset_password_sent_at = today
  reset_password_period_valid?   # returns true

  # reset_password_within = 5.days and reset_password_sent_at = 4.days.ago
  reset_password_period_valid?   # returns true

  # reset_password_within = 5.days and reset_password_sent_at = 5.days.ago
  reset_password_period_valid?   # returns false

  # reset_password_within = 0.days
  reset_password_period_valid?   # will always return false
instance_methods.summary: Checks if the reset password token sent is within the limit time.

def.name: reset_password_period_valid?
def.body:
sent_at = reset_password_sent_at
if sent_at
else
  return false
end
reset_password_within = Mochi.configuration.reset_password_within
if reset_password_within
else
  return false
end
sent_at >= (Time.utc - reset_password_within.days)

instance_methods.name: send_reset_password_instructions
instance_methods.doc:
Resets reset password token and send reset password instructions by email.
Returns the token sent in the e-mail.
instance_methods.summary: Resets reset password token and send reset password instructions by email.

def.name: send_reset_password_instructions_notification
def.body:
(mailer_class = Mochi.configuration.mailer_class) ? (if mailer_class
else
  return
end) : return
(token = reset_password_token) ? (if token
else
  return
end) : return
mailer_class.new.reset_password_instructions(self, token)

def.name: set_reset_password_token!
def.body:
self.reset_password_token = UUID.random.to_s
self.reset_password_sent_at = Time.utc
self.password_reset_in_progress = true
save
reset_password_token

types.name: Trackable
types.doc:
Track information about your user sign in. It tracks the following columns:

* sign_in_count      - Increased every time a sign in is made (by form, openid, oauth)
* current_sign_in_at - A timestamp updated when the user signs in
* last_sign_in_at    - Holds the timestamp of the previous sign in
* current_sign_in_ip - The remote ip updated when the user sign in
* last_sign_in_ip    - Holds the remote ip of the previous sign in
types.summary: Track information about your user sign in.

def.name: update_tracked_fields
def.body:
old_current, new_current = self.current_sign_in_at, Time.utc
self.last_sign_in_at = old_current || new_current
self.current_sign_in_at = new_current
self.sign_in_count || (self.sign_in_count = 0)
self.sign_in_count = self.sign_in_count + 1

def.name: update_tracked_fields!
def.body:
if new_record?
  return
end
update_tracked_fields(request)
self.save

  _first_name = @first_name
  if _first_name.nil?
  else
    json.field("first_name") do

    end
  end
  _email = @email
  if _email.nil?
  else

      _email.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _location = @location
  if _location.nil?
  else
    json.field("location") do
      _location.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _about = @about
  if _about.nil?
  else

    end
  end

    end
  end
end

def.name: location
def.body:
location = [] of String
if self.city
  location << self.city.not_nil!.title
end
if self.country
  location << self.country.not_nil!.title
end
location.empty? ? Nil : location.join(", ")
